SOJOURN.Definition: a temporary stay, e.g. "her sojourn in Rome".

‍LOCK IN.Definition: to get and keep an advantage such as a low price

‍GASTRONOMY.Definition: the art and knowledge involved in preparing and eating good food

‍EARL.Definition: (the title of) a British man of high social rank, between a marquis and a viscount

‍SERIAL.Definition: used to describe someone who does something several times or repeatedly

‍BINGE.Definition: an occasion when an activity is done in an extreme way, especially eating, drinking, or spending money

‍WRAPPED.Definition: covered with paper or other material

‍BIOGRAPHY.Definition: the life story of a person written by someone else

‍COMMITMENT.Definition: willingness to give your time and energy to a job, activity, or something that you believe in

‍GENIUS.Definition: a person with very great and rare natural ability or skill, especially in a particular area such as science or art

‍FILLINGS.Definition: the layer of food inside a sandwich, cake, etc

‍PREDATE.Definition: to have existed or happened before another thing

‍OUT OF THIN AIR.Definition: from nothing, e.g. "I can't come up with €10,000 out of thin air."

‍MEZZE.Definition: a selection of small dishes served as appetizers in parts of the Middle East, the Balkans, Turkey, Greece, and North Africa

‍PLATTERS.Definition: a large plate used for serving food or a meal with one type of food served on a large plate

‍SANDWICHED.Definition: to put something or someone in a small space between two other, usually bigger, things or people

‍LIKELIHOOD.Definition: the chance that something will happen

‍TOOK OFF.Definition: to suddenly start to be successful or popular

‍FIRST MEN.Definition: important men, likely aristocrats or rich men

‍THE BEST THING SINCE SLICED BREAD.Definition: the best and most useful innovation or development invented for a long time

‍ICONIC.Definition: very famous or popular, especially being considered to represent particular opinions or a particular time

‍LEFTOVER.Definition: a leftover part of something is the part that has not been used or eaten when the other parts have been

‍WRAPPED UP.Definition: to cover or surround something in paper, cloth, or other material

‍HIT.Definition: a thing or person that is very popular or successful

‍NOWADAYS.Definition: at the present time, in comparison to the past:

‍SOGGY.Definition: (of things that can absorb water , especially food ) unpleasantly wet and soft

‍TRAVEL HACK.Definition: clever solution for a travel related problem

‍FOR WANT OF.Definition: because of not having (something) because (something) does not exist or is not available

‍ADOPT.Definition: to accept or start to use something new

‍FOUNDING FATHERS.Definition: one of a group of men who started the United States as a country and wrote its constitution

‍ARCHAIC.Definition: of or belonging to an ancient period in history

‍AFRESH.Definition: if you do something afresh, you deal with it again in a new way

‍ARISTOCRATIC.Definition: a class of people who hold high social rank

‍UPHOLD.Definition: to defend or keep a principle or law

‍NOTABLE.Definition: important and deserving attention , because of being very good or interesting

‍PERUSE.Definition: to read through something, especially in order to find the part you are interested in

‍BUCKET LIST.Definition: a list of the things that a person would like to do or achieve before they die

‍BOXING DAY.Definition: in the UK and some other countries, the day after Christmas Day, which is a public holiday

‍PARDON.Definition: to forgive someone for something they have said or done. This word is often used in polite expressions

‍PUN.Definition: a funny use of a word or phrase that has several meanings or that sounds like another word

‍REPUTATION.Definition: the opinion that people in general have about someone or something, or how much respect or admiration someone or something receives , based on past behaviour or character

‍FOR THAT MATTER.Definition: used to show that a statement is true in another situation, e.g. Ming's never been to Spain, or to any European country for that matter.

‍SALES PITCH.Definition: a talk or a way of talking that is intended to persuade you to buy something
